name: Turing College
headline: AI-driven online tech school for busy professionals
description: Turing College is an online AI-driven school for busy professionals. We upskill & reskill in data science & AI, analytics, marketing and programming in 3-12 months with 1on1 support and flexibility.

founders.name: Lukas Kaminskis, Founder
founders.description: Lukas created his first coding bootcamp at 16 years old. At 22, he became a lecturer in software engineering at ISM international university. Lukas has been the CEO of Turing School since 2017. He has continued working with the Harvard CS50 team and several top-tier academics on various EdTech projects up to this day.

founders.name: Tomas Moska, Founder
founders.description: Tomas started his first company at only 17. At 20, he joined his first startup at its founding as a core team member and quickly grew to become a CTO. He is a self-taught engineer with a background in business & economics who studied engineering at the prestigious tech university 42 in Paris, France. At only 27, Tomas already has a decade of management & founder experience. In Turing, Tomas leads product & operation. He also serves as a chairman of the board.

founders.name: Benas Sidlauskas, Founder
founders.description: Ben created a leading global tech network for the Lithuanian diaspora at 19. He organized an event that received attention and Twitter coverage from Tesla and Elon Musk. He also co-organized the biggest alternative investment event in the Baltics. As a CEO, he bootstrapped a startup studio from zero to 350k USD in revenue over one year at the age of 21. Today, together with  Lukas & Tomas and the whole team, Benas is accelerating the transition to data-driven IT learning with the EdTech startup.

generated_description:
Turing College is an innovative online tech school based in Vilnius, Lithuania, founded in 2020 as part of Y Combinator Batch W21. The college is dedicated to providing AI-driven courses tailored for busy professionals looking to upskill or reskill in data science, AI, analytics, marketing, and programming within a nimble timeframe of 3 to 12 months. With a focused mission, Turing College emphasizes flexibility, offering personalized one-on-one support to ensure students can learn at their own pace.

As of now, the college boasts a team of around 50 employees and has expanded its curriculum to include various programs such as Data Analytics, Data Science & AI, Web Development, Digital Marketing & Analytics, and specialized short courses in AI for Business Analytics and AI Engineering.

The approach Turing College takes is quite unique: there are no lectures. Instead, it provides a self-paced learning environment where students simulate the actual work of a tech company, gaining practical experience alongside their theoretical studies. This innovative model has led to impressive outcomes—students report a 97.9% employment rate after graduating, with many finding roles at notable companies like Telia, Nasdaq, and Western Union.

Community is also a vital component of the Turing College experience. Students benefit from a supportive network of peers and mentors, enhancing their soft skills while building a robust portfolio. The college’s personalized learning plans cater not only to new learners stepping into the tech field but also to experienced professionals seeking career advancement.

If you’re looking for a career change or aiming to enhance your skills in today’s digital landscape, Turing College is worth exploring. With programs designed by industry veterans and a commitment to preparing graduates for real-world challenges, it's a compelling option for anyone serious about their career in tech. 

You can find more details on their offerings at their official website: [Turing College](https://www.turingcollege.com).
